title: Bug 6410: File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: Bug 6410: This bug report describes a problem where a Java file appears to be unchanged but is marked as dirtied by code assist.
OB: When using the code assist feature in an IDE, if the cursor is placed inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call and the CtrlSpace shortcut is used, the Java file is marked as dirtied even though no changes were made to the file.
EB: The Java file should not be marked as dirtied if no changes were made to the file after using the code assist feature.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a Java file. 
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call, such as 'I' in the example: 
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I); 
3. Press CtrlSpace to trigger the code assist feature. 

Note: Ensure that no changes are made to the file before or after using the code assist feature.
